intro: Cupaniopsis serrata, commonly known as the serrated cupaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and sandy soils. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and serrated, giving it its common name. The flowers are inconspicuous, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a feature known as dioecy.
